name: Pork Chop and Rice Casserole
author: cdrewcia
summary: This simple recipe was handed down to me from my grandmother.  She was a fabulous cook that could master elaborate dishes, but she also taught me how to make some easy and delicious meals. Slow baking makes this a 'fall of the bone' dish with even tougher cuts of pork!
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of celery soup
directions: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C)
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and brown the pork chops on both sides, 5 to 8 minutes per side
Place the chops into a 9x13-inch baking dish
In a large saucepan, whisk together the cream of chicken soup, cream of celery soup,and milk until smooth
Stir in the rice, and add the butter; bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, and stir until the butter has melted
Pour the rice mixture over the chops; cover the dish with foil
Bake in the preheated oven until tender, about 2 hours
